content.description: Climb the right wall of the alcove with slabby, thin moves to an obvious, horizontal, undercling seam above bolt #1. Hard to onsight, but per usual at the Promised Land, finding the right holds unlocks some sweet beta.
content.location: The bolted line right of the 2 slab routes. #3 in the topo

content.description: Climb the 40 foot crack that starts 10 feet up. This looks like you have to contend with some guano. Find a bolted anchor above the crack.
content.location: It is on the prow of the wall that hosts the other 3 bolted routes here.

content.description:
There are 2 variations to start this: the left hand direct start through a short chimney is around 5.8; or you can start as for

Cruces

, then clip a link-up bolt going left and keep it at 5.6. Either way, this has fun, easy climbing and is a pretty long route.
content.location: It is the farthest left route on the West end wall and is #1 in the topo, or do the direct variation.

content.description: A long slab climb with some techy moves that will make you think while you search around for the best pockets. Worth the long 0.4 mile hike from the main wall.
content.location: There are 2 slab routes on the left side of this alcove. This is the right hand of those 2 routes. #2 in the topo
